When I was on Active Duty, (U.S. Army Field Artillery Officer, 13A MOS). We 
could see that there are many jobs in military that are better done by 
military contractors or professional civilian specialists.
- Guarding static high value target, both point and area. Bodyguard and 
personal security.
-  Low 'presence footprint' security, where civilian population does not 
need to see uniforms.
- High technology maintenance, and operations.
- Plausible deniability for Senior Government officials.
- Food service, facilities, and potable water.
- Heavy transportation and logistics.
-Reduced workload on deployed units and need for lower amount of deployed 
personnell.
- Anything medical, except forward deployed combat hospitals, and field 
medics.
- Excellent transition for demobilised military personell. Especcially 
junior and mid enlisted grades.
-Proper regulation by Federal Law and conduct regulated  by Uniform Code Of 
Military Justice.
-Legal services, especially for defendant defense.
-Routine clerical administration (paperwork).﻿
